document.title: Georgia Standards of Excellence: Elementary Music

4139EEF4500E4A58804EF561CFBD4678.description: Identify distinguishing characteristics of repertoire representing various periods, composers, cultures, styles, and genres.

928010CA0B8C4F6DB42A13A85BC010FC.description: Describe the characteristics of music from different cultures.

B766E3359BD5493189D3F948ECC1428C.description: Describe how music relates to fine arts and other disciplines.

C3D2081591734158A979CB0B23F8C67E.description: Understand relationships between music, the other arts, disciplines outside the arts, history, and culture.

CDE2CD560E39440AA1FCCA7BF68E2AE0.description: Explain how people from different backgrounds judge music and music performances.

7F8D272E4DE34658A3274F9AA188CC70.description: Recognize and demonstrate context-appropriate performer and audience etiquette.

60FBF9E264474B06804A26D25E06C412.description: Demonstrate practice strategies to refine a performance using teacher-based criteria.

937A7B55A9D84C50BE1231E5BAB3121B.description: Evaluate a piano performance using teacher-based criteria (e.g. attention to accuracy of correct notes, written or improvised, rhythm and dynamics).

6B97D5DC791F48CAB4DAE61E9B397FFC.description: Utilize writing skills to describe the elements of music, and the emotions and thoughts that music communicates.

54BA0C8BD5C1408AB228648E8C8EFE4A.description: Listen to a musical recording or video in terms of form, voicing, and dynamic contrast.

756C9714EDB9481CBA97D78DC56D82C9.description: Read about appropriate music based on skill level.

6949BE46097F421C98AF5308A22C36A1.description: Read about, listen to, and describe music.

762E6523C0DE4BD69F2C5A3AD8643F87.description: Student will point out characteristics of pieces being studied and performed (e.g. chords, melodies, context of composition).

0EBAC7B97F1D41A89CF24BBDEAF1BC8A.description: Describe how pianists decide which pieces to learn and perform.

F844EE9BFA394034BA8FA478D750609C.description: Identify basic music vocabulary and symbols representing tempo, meter, dynamics, direction, and other expressive elements.

72495B5094F341ED87E147A486AD6919.description: Notate simple rhythms and melodies utilizing a dictation method.

CEE68713C2C34C3A9128A92CEB4183AA.description: Utilize a counting system and pitch learning procedure to read music appropriate to ability.

3F56B6417E624FC99B080F4958C26DB2.description: Demonstrate all performance skills through performance of music literature at the appropriate level.

6516BFCF36954E648CE157723557872F.description: Recognize skills through performance of musical literature (e.g. rehearsal procedures, steady tempo, rhythmic accuracy, dynamic expression, style).

89675728484445F0B88E00B268CEA0CF.description: Recognize characteristic playing position, posture, and fingering techniques.

6B580F48D66445859C7CC5AAC2DFCD67.description: Perform a varied repertoire of music on instruments, alone and with others.

9548279CBDDD418393F77A3F198D6790.description: Set a short poetic phrase and/or text to music.

31CCEA9A061141AAAE5193BD24AF185B.description: Compose rhythmic exercises and short melodies using traditional and/or non-traditional notations, which incorporate dynamics.

9906232A0CAD4DA5AC52F232D1E36101.description: Compose and arrange music within specified guidelines.

F2030370A3554FAA9DFF979D6FE132A2.description: Demonstrate a rhythmic or melodic ostinato.

32E19CF18FB94BC98123D18E6E96A476.description: Improvise a melody using scales (e.g. pentatonic, major, minor, blues).

78BC1AB4B67A4D5CB85DEEF6D4BCD336.description: Improvise rhythmic patterns by clapping, singing, or playing a repeated note or chord.

20FD53E30809458994ADFEAED3627C01.description: Discuss how the music performed in class relates to the culture and society in which we live.

E8977FA8C2AF4957B798A6AF8AB2B543.description: Identify and compare performance styles of music learned in class.

8C8222499CCD45168A55D8E2D0E5CBDB.description: Understand music in relation to history and culture.

E8820E94AB124EDCB6216F7D96DB25EA.description: Discuss how other subjects are related to music.

C57FD19CB05C404286D84092FD8B10DD.description: Explain the benefits of musical study as part of a well-rounded education.

45147C326A6F4DE9BCE90624CD458593.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the relationships between music, the other arts, and disciplines outside the arts.

FCA584124E9E4BE69413C6632DA6A2D4.description: Use self-reflection and peer feedback to discuss ideas to improve the quality of a performance.

CD41DA7ECE2746439AF97FB1C89EE079.description: Use teacher-based criteria to assess the quality of performance in tone, intonation, balance, dynamics, and rhythm.

99761237288F4A13A0FD7E4449AEB378.description: Evaluate the accuracy of rhythm and tempos for individual and ensemble playing.

BF051CB8D3F247F1BD01FE1DAFD082EB.description: Distinguish between correct and incorrect notes and intonation and demonstrate the ability to adjust accordingly.

7404780833DB4CE4B154A955D1862C09.description: Identify the difference between melody and accompaniment in given examples (e.g. aural, written, performed).

1F61E25031C74767A3F46B16770A74C4.description: Discuss how the basic elements of music, including mood, tempo, contrast, and repetition in selected examples (e.g. aural, written, performed) are important to a performance.

95412051993E432687F3A232684ADC3C.description: Listen to, analyze, and describe music.

D861FCD6D3144084ACF924FBADE037CA.description: Recognize basic symbols for dynamics, tempo, articulation, and expression as used in corresponding literature.

8463AB725C6B436EADB83F656B54BB77.description: Read and notate rhythms (e.g. whole notes, half notes, quarter notes, eighth notes, dotted half notes and their corresponding rests in the time signatures of 4/4, 3/4, and 2/4).

003DC927786F407CB2E5842CFF296052.description: Read and notate notes within key signatures D, G, and C.

81465653D0C94D24ACDA97E28E1526F4.description: Identify notes in the staff and on ledger lines of respective clef.

965A197E57FE44EDA63BEE4DCB41DCB7.description: Demonstrate awareness of individual and group roles within the ensemble relating to balance, blend, dynamics, phrasing, and tempo.

764F6E2D894A4E96A7EA921BC594B101.description: Utilize correct finger patterns in performing scales and repertoire in the keys of D, G, and C.

C66552661EFE4015BD909F60866836A1.description: Produce a characteristic sound using legato, staccato, slurs, detached slur, accent, and pizzicato.

3062D0A3173C45F99DA9FCB5AE748B44.description: Demonstrate correct left-hand position and finger placement, right hand position (bow hold), posture, instrument position, and bow placement.

A9A72B61C53F4023973F6E02EA4917BA.description: Discuss and demonstrate characteristic tone production on a string instrument.

298C5A7A42B94351A4BA6466B719057A.description: Demonstrate an understanding of phrasing through performing simple melodies.

FF5C4736B1CE45BCA567BD180F73FFDA.description: Demonstrate the ability to match pitch and adjust intonation through playing and singing.

5518D07C09354048887FA2DA43C0D6E8.description: Perform a varied repertoire of music on instruments, alone and with others.

00AD1C168B4346F9BC3E2782C75E8458.description: Use teacher-created criteria to refine improvised or composed pieces.

09DB5CEA875A41C29C64ECDD1A16B782.description: Share improvised, composed, or arranged pieces.

7F3CDEA2001640C9B63895BEA122E46B.description: Improvise, compose, or arrange a melody or variation of a melody.

09208122A46141C9931B2EB983A357EA.description: Improvise, compose, or arrange rhythmic patterns (e.g. clapping, singing, playing an instrument).

95A47402617349C2B625CF3357543F79.description: Improvise, compose, and arrange music within specified guidelines.

CFD52688CBBA4FAABBDEFD807E288CED.description: Demonstrate performance etiquette and appropriate audience behavior.

DD1867CF0B5747D6835E3BD3A52704FD.description: Describe how sounds and music are used in daily lives.

77D5A3A90CEE4A32A86C01488CA682DE.description: Perform and respond to music from various historical periods and cultures.

A60F6C35296941FABE2A5C5AA65B7C6E.description: Connect music to history and culture.

D8F93A43A6364F2CA0F6E8C89BE1AC71.description: Describe connections between music and disciplines outside the fine arts.

ADCD537E76234FCEA0D23B1D8BA591E4.description: Describe connections between music and the other fine arts.

F1671B14089046EF96B462DF675CE8DA.description: Connect music to the other fine arts and disciplines outside the arts.

ABA869E6F05A40518F778EB5BEA0D898.description: Respond to contrasts and events in music with locomotor movement (e.g. walk, run, hop, jump, gallop, skip) and non-locomotor movement (e.g. bend, twist, stretch, turn).

543FD87D5D804A3E9B8C5AC0C8CD31C7.description: Move to a varied repertoire of music, alone and with others.

5A057A1D85B349FAA12972ADAEF0BF1E.description: Explain personal preferences for specific musical works using appropriate vocabulary.

9148B78FCEBC4C71AF93389D7FFEA36E.description: Refine music and music performances by applying personal, peer, and teacher feedback.

D16D55C2BC274E6A90BFA0830D4AC0BC.description: Evaluate music (e.g. learned, student-composed, improvised) and musical performances, by self and others, when given specific criteria.

9EBAFF5F444C47EBB9068DA78E1ABA5A.description: Aurally distinguish between different voices (e.g. whisper, shout, talk, sing).

5B514FDC780341C9AC8E9F68C36B0C8D.description: Identify basic classroom instruments by sight and sound.

CFACD38E9F2C462FA5A3D15D2DEDFF4C.description: Describe music using appropriate vocabulary (e.g. high/low, loud/soft, fast/slow, long/short).

3C95ED36C7ED419DBDD0519A52BD54C9.description: Distinguish between contrasts in music (e.g. pitch, duration, dynamics, tempo, timbre, form).

301A8B2363B84DFBB7883014522687E3.description: Listen to, analyze, and describe music.

D34053AA50E54A32A5563C2EB4D48653.description: Read simple melodic contour representations (e.g. roller coaster).

15FB7DA4B92947D2962ADE7C0090A7D9.description: Read, notate, and identify quarter notes, quarter rests, and barred eighth notes using iconic or standard notation.

965B43061A734251B53FC65168EBF58A.description: Perform steady beat and simple rhythmic patterns with appropriate technique using body percussion and classroom instruments.

5121AEB16AD14B0B8D4F95DA3BA03B0B.description: Echo simple rhythmic patterns with appropriate technique using body percussion and classroom instruments.

3759FDBA231B43E6B0D21DB1D89A516F.description: Perform a varied repertoire of music on instruments, alone and with others.

DB1CB15ADEB64726AC78B8E896679666.description: Sing multiple songs representing various genres, tonalities, meters, and cultures, including at least one song in a foreign language.

DBC87AA2E5BC4D8AB9033342428AC65B.description: Echo simple singing and speech patterns.

A008F02C6E96470296E64649BCB5B294.description: Sing simple accompanied and unaccompanied melodies in a limited range, using head voice.

4A3F6C1971DF4583A5BB67C149157347.description: Sing a varied repertoire of music, alone and with others.

2770FDB9779844CAADA13D1215DB6CB8.description: With guidance, share a final version of personal musical work with peers.

01CD90A54B77400FA2A61B5B1FEFF4E5.description: Vary the text for familiar melodies, chants, and poems.

7205874AF5E84A1B8601F720CB71A12C.description: Create simple rhythmic patterns (e.g. quarter notes, quarter rests, barred eighth notes).

BF658BAD43214D5E8D7DAE208ADF7B9D.description: Create sound effects to accompany songs, poems, and stories.

442609972F8344DD8C8E6567AD843042.description: Compose and arrange music within specified guidelines.

4D4124E38B534B36BE09C8E6E64B64FC.description: Improvise using various sound sources (e.g. electronic sounds, found sounds, body percussion, classroom instruments).

1A4FC2D9B5494107AD09B40E3E68E16A.description: Improvise soundscapes (e.g. weather, animals, other sound effects).

0902040FF0DD4BCA88B6A65CDF9C7FB5.description: Discuss and apply appropriate audience etiquette and active listening in selected musical settings.

A41A16C33A784F1CA86A6734EF379FD8.description: Identify the historical period, composer, culture, and style of music presented in class.

7330DFA9B3ED42D9B509CEEDE766B3EC.description: Demonstrate stylistic characteristics of a varied repertoire, including world music, through vocal performance.

502385D5639C4596871E22E13777E1E8.description: Identify historical and cultural characteristics of a varied repertoire, including world music.

FBE567F230DA4FC0961CCA393A53E36C.description: Relate musical ideas and works with societal, cultural, and historical contexts to deepen understanding.

6941532BC5F146E7BBFD7BA8A5E81B99.description: Describe how a musician's interests, knowledge, and skills determine how they create, perform, and respond to music.

4579170313174F0FA4BCA8E1E4A4A5E8.description: Discuss how music relates to personal development and enjoyment of life.

67BDFF9B99144422B053B286936572B6.description: Synthesize and relate knowledge and personal experiences to make music.

CF64B79625C84D94A7D3F0E5FC3BA08C.description: Using self-reflection and peer feedback, listen to and evaluate group music performances with attention to vocal technique, accuracy of pitch, and rhythm, diction, and dynamics.

9FB9DD868B0E4443AD63605EB4C74E30.description: Apply criteria to evaluate musical works.

5BC5F53C085B4FBB91F00BB7AA9DDA5A.description: Discuss how the basic elements of music, including mood, tempo, contrast, and repetition, in selected examples (e.g. aural, written, performed), are important to a performance.

0A6615C29A1B447EAE94306EC5722A76.description: Describe the emotions and thoughts that music conveys.

23E5D2909BE64A6E8E93362725E1DFF2.description: Listen to and describe the elements of a musical performance including form, voicing, and dynamic contrast.

C940E61F1DEA4180BDCED6DFB027FC7A.description: Describe a musical score in terms of rhythm, melody, and form.

A8CB08A6CAF741C898B7C91484305B50.description: Perceive, analyze, and interpret meaning in musical works.

FE79293A8890485E92F9FAA2DFF63E4F.description: Exhibit appropriate rehearsal and performance etiquette.

D408B42D0CA643C7A7D0060E9AB8E7C9.description: Sing selected music from memory for public performance at least twice per year.

C4FBC71A0833492DB192CBA98C94596F.description: Demonstrate and respond to basic conducting patterns and gestures representing tempo, expression, and vocal technique.

F5AC6E4D877C49A3B7A506E2A4A2EFBA.description: Demonstrate technical accuracy and expressive qualities in performance of a varied repertoire of music.

82072ADF91834134ACF0744F96299A43.description: Convey meaning through the presentation of musical works as the school setting permits.

C960347588F941968BC93ADF4FAEA1B8.description: Utilize aural skills to match pitch, improve intonation, and sing with attention to ensemble balance and blend, in one or more vocal parts.

E3B604B6909F4C1EA906F3AB975A91C3.description: Demonstrate pure vowel sounds and articulate voiced and unvoiced consonants.

02560A4016D740BD8C7E17C99DB249DB.description: Identify aspects of vocal range and tone.

1F3DB5CD37DF43049D8D0D4390DF4D5B.description: Demonstrate appropriate singing posture and breathing techniques.

250A579197EE47D091C247EEBA268DC7.description: Develop and refine musical techniques and works for presentation.

81E37BC5B5BD49EBAB6EE82AED95B3C1.description: Read and notate music using available technology.

1DFEEE862C5A41AB82EA6AC484BA80F4.description: Notate simple rhythms and melodies from aural examples utilizing a dictation method.

763B310CFA8E446CA7AC80FED2FDB7D5.description: Identify basic music vocabulary and symbols representing tempo, meter, dynamics, and other expressive elements.

686939705F014B509FD50AFDB4981847.description: Utilize a rhythmic and melodic system to read and sing music appropriate to ability.

AE9CEE51F08E42C3AF960C9901C63B5E.description: Analyze, interpret, and select musical works for presentation.

021E63D2564B4CB88BF78370C856FD28.description: Use teacher-created criteria to refine improvised or composed pieces.

226F54537B9340E0867277264CE5F436.description: Share improvised, composed, or arranged pieces.

9877F20F91134FE1AFF142A6B1DF3E8B.description: Organize, develop, and revise musical ideas and works.

EB58FC98419B4C179B33138CE61F5C3A.description: Set short poetic phrases and texts to music.

C10E9194D67547648142CA99C00CFF16.description: Create physical movements for warm-ups and repertoire to distinguish various musical ideas.

58087FD3162D498AABF1C387C1C967AE.description: Create basic rhythmic and melodic accompaniments to support other elements of musical performance (e.g. ostinato).

902A5C946D13422C9992A2EFB68CFAFF.description: Improvise simple rhythmic and melodic patterns.

A0E6BC85B50A4B0FA7F0A95CB9759793.description: Generate and conceptualize musical ideas and works.
